titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Jeanne Murray Walker (b. 1944) is a poet, playwright, and professor at the University of Delaware, where she teaches courses in poetry and scriptwriting. Walker is a Commonwealth Speaker for the Pennsylvania Humanities Council, and travels the state to speak about poetry. She has published six volumes of poetry and has been featured in many anthologies and journals, including American Poetry Review and The Nation.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of reviews and articles related to Jeanne Murray Walker. The collection also includes forty-two literary magazines to which Walker contributed, and a CD of "Harrod & Funck Live" which includes a vocal drawn from Walker's poem "Grasshopper."

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
